Bom, realmente tem uma grande diferen√ßa para esses dois jogos, isso √© √≥bvio, mas esse primeiro jogo tem algo a mais, e √© exatamente o que o Left 4 Dead 2 tem que esse aqui n√£o tem: as armas!

[h1] A crying woman... You think she's sad because the mall's closed??[/h1]

After Half-Life 2, Counter-Strike: Source, Team Fortress 2 and Portal, we‚Äôve come to expect nothing less from Valve. Left 4 Dead explores the same basic premise as most classic zombie movies from Dawn of the Dead, Night of the Living Dead, 28 Days Later and so on and the coolest thing about is the fact that Valve doesn‚Äôt even try to hide it. It‚Äôs got all the crazy and wild cliche you‚Äôve come to expect from a zombie movie or a TV Show. You play as one of the four survivors immune from the deadly virus. The survivor consists of Bill - Bill, the grizzled veteran, Zoey ‚Äì the spoiled princess, Francis aka The Biker and finally Louis, the middle-class office worker that happens to be have importance in every movie or TV show. This game was released back in 2008 might I add, way before Zombies became a part of pop-culture like the time when The Walking Dead became a phenomenon.   

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Aged like a wine. Couple thousands of people still playing in 2020 despite being over a decade old. 
+Playing with friends is awesome, really puts you in the shoes of classic zombie movie with hard R-Rated violence and gore.
+Killing and torching zombies couldn‚Äôt be more fun! You‚Äôll be killing hordes of undead Nazis. 
+The atmosphere is tense, with creepy soundtrack. Perfect for co-op.
+Large arsenal of crazy weapons you‚Äôd expect in a zombie apocalyptic world. Besides guns medkits, pain pills, flashlights, molotovs, pipe bombs, gasoline, propane tanks are equally helpful to keep you and your team survive. 
+Advanced enemy A.I that acts like a dynamic difficulty setting. It will throw more hordes if you‚Äôve got a skilled/experienced team. If you‚Äôre having a hard time the A.I automatically eases you with health kits and ammo. The developers call this system ‚Äòthe Director.‚Äô 
+Combat is similar to pretty much the similar to like other games using Source engine like Counter Strike Global Offensive, No Room in Hell, Insurgency, and Team Fortress 2. Just point, aim and shoot. 
+Gameplay holds up quite well if you‚Äôve played other Valve shooters you know what to expect.  
+Excellent port. Windows and Mac support. Flawless performance, supports high refresh rates and resolution. 
+Creative presentation. They are four scenarios and each of it starts with a movie like poster and ends with movie style credits. Adds it little flavor to the mix y‚Äôknow.
+Group conversations are really fun and engaging. The amount of dialogue each character should please you considering the fact that most Valve games don‚Äôt have a protagonist with voice acting. Eh, can‚Äôt imagine a fun zombie shooter with no funny one liners.  
+Perfectly captures the tension and the action of Hollywood zombie movies.
+So many enemy types. There‚Äôs are Hunters that pin you down from a long distance, then there‚Äôs Tanker with lots of hitpoints, Boomers that vomits toxic gas on you making you blind for a few seconds, the smoker, which has a frog-like tongue that can grab a survivor by the throat and finally the good ol‚Äô horde zombies typically seen everyone most notably in Killing Floor, Dying Light and Call of Duty Zombies. 
+Developer commentary, remote play, LAN play Steam cloud, achievements, trading card, VAC and workshop support. 
+Extremely good replayability.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Although this might be subjective to some, I felt playing this solo is extremely boooooringgg. Please don‚Äôt buy this if you‚Äôre looking for a good single player experience because you‚Äôre most likely going to be disappointed customer.
-Please don‚Äôt play this with bots but if you‚Äôre still up for single player keep in mind that the bots have not really improved, they cannot pick up explosives and have slow reaction times.
-Lacks a proper narrative. Anyone expecting a good story please step aside; Thank You üòä 
-Random matchmaking is filled with toxic people and campers. They won‚Äôt mind you from dying.
-Level design is a bit linear. 
-Graphics haven‚Äôt aged well enough to please everyone
-No PS3/PS4 edition. Crossplay would have been really fun with left4dead. Xbox one supports x360 version through backwards compatibility. 
-Campaign might be too short for some players who don‚Äôt like replaying the same levels over and over.

[h1]The Bottom Line[/h1]
Left4Dead is a fun co-op first-person shooter so good that it inspired a lot of developers, big and small to create tons of zombie shooters and fun co-op adventure games. If you‚Äôre new to multiplayer games this is a great place to start but if you‚Äôve already played tons of modern zombie shooters then you might not like this as much since its dated and offer linear maps. Definitely recommend getting at sale price. Also I suggest playing with friends.

[h1]My Rating: 8.5/10[/h1] 
What do you think about Left4Dead. Tell me in the comments section below üòä

Left 4 Dead √© um jogo excelente de a√ß√£o com muitos ZUMBIS!!

Sendo o L4D original, o jogo √© muito bom ainda pros dias de hoje, com seus mapas originais e personagens que eu adoro, √© garantido a divers√£o

O jogo possui seu modo campanha que cumpre o que promete e o seu multiplayer que infelizmente n√£o sei dizer o estado atual do multiplayer por ainda n√£o ter tido tempo de tentar, mas pelo que eu li no f√≥rum n√£o parece ter tanta gente jogando se esse for seu foco eu recomendo tentar o 2 que √© garantido as partidas.

Vale a pena comprar?
Sim. Se voc√™ quer comprar pra testar a campanha e ver a jogabilidade nos seus mapas originais eu recomendo, agora pro multiplayer vai depender, se tiver gente pra voc√™ jogar o que eu acho dif√≠cil, mas nada impede de voc√™ procurar gente no f√≥rum do game aqui no Steam pra jogar caso falte players nos servidores.
The most classic coop zombie shooter I have ever played.

Unlike the second game, still contains the "Clear" voice command, which I thought was sorely lacking from L4D2. Overall, feels a lot more... Source-y in appearance, retaining a lot of the features from that particular point in Half-Life's... half-life.

Still a lot of fun for what you get, though the only real upside in terms of playing this instead of playing the same campaigns in Left 4 Dead 2 is that of speedrunning (or the "Last Stand" map, the gamemode for which made it into the second game, but not the map itself). A lot of broken map fixes and heavily abused gameplay elements that made it into the second game still survive here. But I wonder... can you?

Polish Language
Uwazam ze warto kupic pierwsza czesc gry Left 4 Dead 
Zalety:
- Fajna grafika 
- Te same postacie w drugiej czesci L4D2
- Dla slabych komputerow i laptopow w sam raz
- Nie ma duzo potworow tak jak w L4D2 (Spittera,Jockeya,Chargera)
- Fajna muzyka w menu (Depresyjna)
- Te same tryby gier podobne tak jak w L4D2
- Jezeli chcesz kupic gre to dla kolekcji bo ja nie gralem duzo 
Wady:
- Moim zdanie nie wiem jak wam ale prze≈Çadowanie bronii troche gorsze jest
- Wedlug mnie gra powinna byc lekko tansza bo w drugiej czesci L4D2 macie wiecej kampanii z 14 lub 13 a w L4D1 z 6 kampanii
- Brak warsztatu steam
- Brak broni do walki wrecz
Ocena:7.99/10
English Language
I think it's worth buying the first part of Left 4 Dead
Advantages:
- Cool graphics
- The same characters in the second part of L4D2
- For weak computers and laptops just right
- There are not many monsters like in L4D2 (Spitter, Jockey, Charger)
- Cool music on the menu (Depressive)
- Same game modes as L4D2
- If you want to buy a game, it's for the collection, because I haven't played much
Disadvantages:
- In my opinion, I don't know about you, but reloading is a bit worse
- In my opinion, the game should be slightly cheaper because in the second part of L4D2 you have more campaigns from 14 or 13 and in L4D1 from 6 campaigns
- No steam workshop
- No melee weapons
Score: 7.99 / 10
